intro: Casearia hostmanniana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that appear in the summer months. Its fruit is a small, bright purple berry that ripens in the fall, attracting birds and other wildlife. The leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a slightly serrated margin.
